articles.title: UN Security Council Approves US Resolution Establishing International Force In G
articles.summary: The UN Security Council on Monday evening approved the U.S.-sponsored resolution on the Gaza Strip, a measure hailed as pivotal for stabilizing the territory after two years of war. Thirteen members voted in favor, while Russia and China abstained. U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations Mike Waltz praised the resolution as ‚Äúhistoric and constructive,‚Äù stressing the urgent need to prevent renewed violence. articles.title: Wild bears attacked 196 people in Japan between April and October
articles.summary: A total of 196 people were injured or killed in wild bear attacks across Japan between April and October, the Environment Ministry said Monday. The figure for the first seven months of fiscal 2025, including 12 fatalities, is approaching the country's record annual high of 219 casualties recorded in fiscal 2023. In October alone, 88 people were attacked by bears, seven of whom died, with both figures marking record highs for a single month. By pr

articles.title: Could This AI Stock Hit a $1 Trillion Valuation Before 2030 ?
articles.summary: A market cap of $1 trillion, while more common than it used to be, is still a major milestone. Only the 11 most valuable companies in the world have accomplished it so far. At its current value, Palantir Technologies ( PLTR 1.59% ) , an artificial intelligence (AI) data analytics company, doesn't look like it will join the trillion-dollar club in the near future. articles.title: Best Stock to Buy Right Now : Apple vs . Amazon
articles.summary: Apple ( AAPL 1.82% ) and Amazon ( AMZN 0.78% ) have become household names. You very well may use one of their products every day. They've also been successful and rewarded investors. Apple's market capitalization has grown to more than $4 trillion, while Amazon's is $2.6 trillion as of Nov. 12.
